Authors: Evelina L.W., Rizkiansyah M., Muslikhin, Prawira I., Irawan R.E.
Title: Comparative forest preservation campaign government and NGO on Indonesia instagram
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communications, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Evelina, L.W., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communications, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rizkiansyah, M., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communications, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Muslikhin, Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communications, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prawira, I., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communications, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Irawan, R.E., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communications, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study seeks to find out how educational communication in fire disasters in Riau was not discussed by previous studies using virtual ethnographic methods. The development of social media led to campaigns about the environment entering the realm of cyberspace. Including the campaign of the ministry of environment and environmental vehicles in overcoming forest fires in Indonesia. This research is looking for a solution to the question of how the Indonesian Ministry of Environment's campaign and environmental environment can provide information while simultaneously making the public aware of forest fires on Instagram social media. The theory and concept of this study used Social Networking, campaign models and social interaction in cyberspace communities. The research method used virtual ethnography where the data collect from Instagram Ministry of Environment and Forestry and NGO Walhi. The number of data comment to analyse is five post with more than 500 comments from Walhi Instagram and 300 posts in the KLHK Instagram. The data analysis technique uses techniques from Creswell with six stages of data analysis. Data analysed through four levels, there are media space, media documents, media objects and experience. The results showed that most campaigns were responded to by critics of the Indonesian government which allowed the private sector to open the development area by burning forests. The findings of this study are that there is community dissatisfaction with the Indonesian government for supporting private companies to burn forests to open new land. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Campaign; Comparative; Forest preservation; Government; Instagram; NGO
Index Keywords: Computers; Data handling; Deforestation; Fires; Information analysis; Information management; Social networking (online); Data analysis techniques; Ethnographic methods; Forest preservation; Ministry of environments; Private companies; Private sectors; research methods; Social interactions; Fire hazards

Title: Search engine optimization in news production online marketing practice in Indonesia online news media
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Prawira, I., Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia; Rizkiansyah, M., Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: The number of online news media in Indonesia is growing rapidly yet media research, it is focused on its function as a tool of democracy. Like other businesses on the Internet, online news media needs to be open to innovation in the newsroom and know how to market their product through search engine optimization (SEO). This article adopts a constructivist innovation approach in the newsroom to understand the online news media production process that utilizes Search Engine Optimization (SEO). The research was conducted by ethnography method in three major online news media in Indonesia namely liputan6. com, detik.com and metrotvnews.com during January-March 2017. The research data was obtained from interviews with more than 30 journalists and observations in the newsroom. Results show that structure of an organization, work practice, and attitude influences the adoption of SEO in the newsroom. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: Indonesia online news media; Innovation in newsroom; Search engine marketing; Search engine optimization (SEO)

Authors: Djuyandi Y., Prawira I., Irawan R.E.
Title: Media neutrality in Indonesian presidential election 2014
Affiliations: Department of Political Science, Padjadjaran University, Bandung, Indonesia; Department of Communication Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Padjadjaran University, Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Djuyandi, Y., Department of Political Science, Padjadjaran University, Bandung, Indonesia; Prawira, I., Department of Communication Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Irawan, R.E., Padjadjaran University, Bandung, Indonesia
Abstract: The balance of the news conveyed by the media to the public becomes a benchmark of democratic system in a country, but in the 2014 presidential election seen that the neutrality of the media is fading. Some mass media should present impartial information, but in fact the media take sides or support one of the presidential candidates. On the basis of these reasons then this study was conducted, with the intention of doing an analysis of neutrality of the media in the Presidential election in 2014. In analyzing this phenomenon, researcher then is outlining some of the concepts and theories, including the theory of media neutrality. This research was conducted using qualitative methods, where the source data consists of primary and secondary data. The primary data obtained through interviews with informants from the media. Based on research that has been done, it is known that the neutrality of the media in Indonesia during the presidential elections of 2014 in the end is questionable. The reason is a lot of media, either openly or secretly, then sided with presidential candidate. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.

Title: The irony of national traveling industry in the midst of the intensifying of traveling programs at Indonesian television
Authors with affiliations: Irawan, R.E., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Prawira, I., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: This study would like to find about the link between the intensifying of traveling programs in Indonesian national television program compare with growth of the national tourism industry. Although the amount and duration of the roads program improved, but it is not significantly help the expansion of the national tourism industry. This study aims to gain a critical overview of the traveling program’s existence at the television industry with the improvement of tourism in Indonesia. This study used a qualitative method in which data is obtained by using the literature method. The results of this study indicate that despite a growing number of programs and the duration of traveling program title at Indonesian television, but because of the reluctance of the traveling program in the Indonesian television shown Indonesian tourist destinations, bringing the total number of foreign tourists to Indonesia is less than the number of Indonesian who traveling abroad. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Indonesian television program; Tourism; Traveling industry; Traveling program
References: Shirley, B., (2010) Impact Media, , Publisher Salemba Humanika, Jakarta; Morissan, C.A., Omar, F., (2010) Mass Communication Theory, , Ghalia Indonesia, Jakarta; Muhammad, M., (2007) Communications and Broadcasting Regulation, , Kencana Jakarta; Ratings Data and AGB Nielsen 2014 Share; John, V., (2008) Theory of Communication, , Kencana, Jakarta; West, R., Turner, L.H., (2008) Introduction to the Theory of Communication, , Publisher Salemba, Jakarta
